title: How to Position Objects Precisely in set.a.light 3D

steps.headline: Make sure that set.a.light is set to the correct measurements, imperial or metric.
steps.description: Go to Settings and then select the correct one.

steps.headline: Click on the Grid icon that is at the top left of your digital workspace.
Select the Pencil icon right beside the Grid icon.
steps.description: This will show the exact measurements when you adjust any object in the studio.

steps.headline: Start moving things around.
steps.description: While moving anything, you can see that you will see the exact measurements on the screen. Don't worry if you can't get it exactly. You can get it about where you want it and finesse the rest at the left of your screen.

steps.headline: Put your light about where you want it.
steps.description: You know, its initial position (about where you think you want it first...). You will be using the tools mentioned above.

steps.headline: Clicking on the light stand (for this studio light, and something similar for any other vertically moving object), move it up or down, depending on your requirements.
Check the direction of your light.
steps.description: After you move it, you will need to readjust where it is pointed out.

steps.headline: Click on the ruler on the left side of the screen.
Click at the bottom of the object that you want to measure.
steps.description: For example, for the light, click on the center of the light stand.

steps.headline: Drag the 'measuring tape' where you want it.
steps.description: Usually, that would be measuring the distance from your subject.

text: Studio Measurements Make sure that set.a.light is set to the correct measurements, imperial or metric. Go to Settings and then select the correct one. Click on the Grid icon that is at the top left of your digital workspace. Grid enabled studio floor Select the Pencil icon right beside the Grid icon. This will show the exact measurements when you adjust any object in the studio. Start moving things around. While moving anything, you can see that you will see the exact measurements on the screen. Don't worry if you can't get it exactly. You can get it about where you want it and finesse the rest at the left of your screen. Lighting Measurements Put your light about where you want it. You know, its initial position (about where you think you want it first...). You will be using the tools mentioned above. Clicking on the light stand (for this studio light, and something similar for any other vertically moving object), move it up or down, depending on your requirements.  Check the direction of your light. After you move it, you will need to readjust where it is pointed out. Getting the Measurements Click on the ruler on the left side of the screen.  Click at the bottom of the object that you want to measure. For example, for the light, click on the center of the light stand. Drag the 'measuring tape' where you want it. Usually, that would be measuring the distance from your subject.
